@iamscicomm I figure it's because foxes in urban areas are more nocturnal rather than crepuscular, so they interact with cats less. But IDK

@iamscicomm Everything I have is purely anecdotal, but it seemed at the time like they just didn't see the point in competing. Really weird
@iamscicomm I didn't! Someone else in the course was doing his thesis on foxes, didn't want to step on his toes. Never got back around to it
@iamscicomm But a friend did good work on urban foxes, and that went pretty well. I got distracted by new media and transhumanism :P
@iamscicomm Wanted to know why they never seemed to conflict much, outreach seemed like the best way to get evidence. Never went anywhere
@iamscicomm I was interested in the interaction between urban foxes and feral cats in Dublin City Centre, so I went and did a Masters
